article: Many years ago when the world was a simpler place there lived a shoemaker. He used  _  silk and soft leather to make the greatest shoes. Colorful shoes lined the shelves of his store. One little girl, Rachel, often looked through the  _  into the store. One day while Rachel was looking again, the shoemaker  _  at her side. "Well, dear, which shoes would you take?" he said, smiling. Rachel was  _  as she hadn't noticed the little man. "Oh! I ...I was just  _  ," Rachel said. "I can't afford them and I would never take anything that doesn't belong to me." The shoemaker said, "I meant to give you a pair as a(n)  _  ." Rachel stared at the shoemaker. A small pointed ear could be seen underneath(...) his hat. The guy  _  Rachel's curious gaze and fixed his hat tightly over his ear  _  . "Why don't you wear a pair of your own beautiful shoes?" Rachel questioned him, smiling. "I am always working and have no need of  _  shoes," he explained. Rachel's smile  _  . "I have no need of good shoes either," Rachel said in a sad voice and limped away. A few days later, Rachel was walking past the shoe shop when the shoemaker waved her into the shop. Looking around, Rachel said, "You have every color of the rainbow here." The shoemaker said, "They are the colors of the rainbow, Rachel."  _  a drawer , he took out the most beautiful pair of shoes Rachel had ever seen. The shoemaker placed the shoes onto her feet. "Take a  _  , Rachel," he said. "I ...I can't," Rachel said with a tear. "Yes, Rachel, you can," the shoemaker  _  . Rachel stood up staight. Deliberately she took a  _  , followed by another and another. "I can do it. I can do it," she said, walking easily across the floor, not limping at all. The shoemaker laughed  _  and said, "I told you they were magic shoes..."
